readability_reflection: I find concatenation more readable and clear, probably because I've always used it.
comprehension_debugging: Interpolation was useful when it was clear (for example: "name = {name} age = {age}"). But otherwise, I find concatenation to be more clear (for example: { ( {1} {2} ) } was unclear).
preference_rationale: I would choose concatenation as it feels more precise and clear.
learning_curve: I haven't used interpolation much, so I was much more familiar with concatenation. This made it easier to understand concatenation rather than interpolation.
suggestions_improvement: I'm not sure of a great solution for this, but using {1} to mean "1" felt unnecessary, and { ( {1} {2} {3} ) } was unclear.
